references.paper_title: Apprenticeship learning via inverse reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper introduces apprenticeship learning, a foundational technique used in imitation learning, which is central to the methodology of the main paper.

references.paper_title: Do As I Can, Not As I Say: Grounding Language in Robotic Affordances
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it addresses the challenge of grounding language in robotic control, a key problem tackled by the main paper's proposed method.

references.paper_title: Alignment-based compositional semantics for instruction following
references.reason: This paper is relevant because it explores compositional semantics for instruction following, which provides theoretical background for the task of generating interpretable feedback.

references.paper_title: Constitutional AI: Harmlessness from AI Feedback
references.reason: This paper is relevant due to its focus on using AI feedback for improving AI systems, which aligns with the main paper's goal of using LLM feedback to improve policies.

references.paper_title: Touchdown: Natural Language Navigation and Spatial Reasoning in Visual Street Environments
references.reason: This paper introduces the Touchdown benchmark, one of the three benchmarks used in the main paper to evaluate the proposed approach.
